description: Please bookmark the url. Once a stable website is created, the website can be searched from all search engine.
title: New ISAC website

description: Valentines day
title: Happy Valentines day
Makar Sankranti
description: Celebrates the harvest and the beginning of spring. Symbolizes new beginnings and prosperity. **Social message:** Share and cherish the bounty with those less fortunate.

title: Basant Panchami
description: Welcomes spring and the goddess Saraswati. Celebrated with flying kites and yellow attire. **Social message:** Embrace knowledge and creativity, let your dreams take flight.

title: Holi
description: Festival of colors, celebrating love, forgiveness, and the victory of good over evil. **Social message:** Spread joy and unity, embrace diversity.

title: Vaisakhi
description: Sikh New Year, celebrating the harvest and the founding of the Khalsa. **Social message:** Live with equality, valor, and community spirit.

title: Ganesh Chaturthi
description: Honors Lord Ganesha, the god of wisdom and auspicious beginnings. **Social message:** Remove obstacles, embrace knowledge and wisdom.

title: Dussehra
description: Celebrates the victory of good over evil, marked by the burning of effigies of Ravana. **Social message:** Stand up for righteousness, conquer inner demons.

title: Diwali
description: Festival of lights, symbolizing the triumph of light over darkness and knowledge over ignorance. **Social message:** Share the light of knowledge, dispel negativity.

title: Christmas
description: Celebrates the birth of Jesus Christ, promoting love, peace, and goodwill. **Social message:** Spread kindness and compassion, embrace the spirit of giving.

title: Mahashivratri
description: Honors Lord Shiva, celebrating creation and overcoming temptation. **Social message:** Cultivate inner strength, conquer negative desires.

title: Gudi Padwa
description: Marathi New Year, marking the beginning of spring and celebrating victory. **Social message:** Embrace new beginnings, honor traditions with a modern twist.

title: Eid al-Fitr
description: Islamic festival marking the end of Ramadan, celebrating self-discipline and community. **Social message:** Foster empathy, share blessings with others.

title: Guru Purnima
description: Honors spiritual teachers and gurus. **Social message:** Respect and seek knowledge, appreciate guidance.

title: Onam
description: Kerala harvest festival, celebrating King Mahabali and prosperity. **Social message:** Honor nature's bounty, share prosperity with all.

title: Durga Puja
description: Honors Goddess Durga, celebrating the triumph of good over evil. **Social message:** Empower yourself and others, fight for justice.

title: Palm Sunday
description: Celebrates the triumphant entry of Jesus into Jerusalem.

title: Ascension Day
description: Commemorates the ascension of Jesus into heaven.

title: Pentecost
description: Celebrates the descent of the Holy Spirit upon the disciples.

title: Laylat al-Qadr
description: Night of Power within Ramadan, considered the holiest night in Islam.
social_message: Deepen faith, seek forgiveness, and pray for blessings.

title: Islamic New Year
description: Marks the beginning of the Islamic calendar year.
social_message: Reflect on renewal, commit to good deeds, and celebrate community.

title: Mawlid al-Nabi
description: Celebrates the birthday of Prophet Muhammad.
social_message: Honor the Prophet's teachings, show compassion, and promote unity.

description: Days of special observance and meditation. Dates vary based on lunar calendar.
title: Uposatha Days
social_message: Practice mindfulness, cultivate virtue, and connect with the community.

title: Magha Puja
description: Commemorates the gathering of 1,250 enlightened disciples before the Buddha.
social_message: Seek harmony, unity, and the teachings of the Buddha.

title: Katina Ceremony
description: Offering of new robes to monks at the end of the monsoon season.
social_message: Practice generosity, gratitude, and support for the monastic community.

title: Paryushan Mahaparva
description: Eight-day period of spiritual introspection and fasting.

title: Mahavir Jayanti
description: Celebrates the birthday of Lord Mahavira, the last Jain Tirthankara (spiritual leader).
social_message: Honor Lord Mahavira's teachings, embrace non-violence and compassion.

title: Samvatsari
description: Jain New Year, celebrating the liberation of the first Tirthankara.
social_message: Reflect on spiritual progress, commit to ahimsa (non-violence), and celebrate new beginnings.
